This does not necessarily mean that you are required to implement all recommendations, or that you must run all Linux virtual machines that way. If you are confident enough that for some Linux servers the risks are less, then you may decide to lower the fences for those Linux virtual machines. As always, you must make the tradeoff between security, flexibility, and ease of use. Chapter 15. Miscellaneous recipes and helpful information 455 15.8 Mitigating SSH client timeout disconnects Often times when a firewall exists between your workstation and a Linux server, sessions that are seen by the firewall as idle can be forcefully severed by the firewall, or even by Linux in some scenarios. This situation can be incredibly frustrating to someone who is trying to administer the system and is forced to focus their attention elsewhere for some amount of time.
